website_summaries.verdict: Good pick for an efficient and stable online experience, even when multiple devices are streaming simultaneously.
pros: Dual-band transmissions ensure high-speed performance even in congested areas
6 antennas help deliver a solid connection
cons: Some owners say the range is more limited than advertised

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router and fabulous technical support
customer_reviews.text: Works well sending a strong signal throughout my house. Superior technical support-- reachable, knowledgeable, patient, and courteous. I had a complicated setup and they were right there with me for over an hour to make sure that everything was working well.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey Pines

customer_reviews.title: works great no buffering with 3 tvs 1 of which is ...
customer_reviews.text: 60 m download 6 up internet service. works great no buffering with 3 tvs 1 of which is 4k , 2 pcs and two phones all streaming wireless.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Did not extend Wifi better than current Sagemcom router from Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this "Long Range" router to address wifi coverage on the second floor, opposite side of the house from my modem. Unfortuanately, it did not perform as well as my current Spectrum router according to my speed test app. In fact coverage actually got worse when I inserted this router into the mix. While super easy to set up, it did not perform as well as current Sagemcom Fast 5260, so this will be going back. Maybe my Spectrum router is better than I thought as I just assumed anything would be better than what cable companies issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ricker

customer_reviews.title: Received in good order and on dated specified
customer_reviews.text: Received in good order and on dated specified. Have hooked it up and it is working fine. I am very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Momoney

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Had product a little over a month and it stop working. I would have expected more from Motorola. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buggy, short range, and no fixes available
customer_reviews.text: New out of box several menu items never load, including several advanced options and security options. Several factory resets did not resolve this, and there is no firmware upgrade available. Range is only about 75 ft before multiple devices claim the wifi is "degraded"
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: 4G setting will work there with a poor signal. The 5G setting will not work there ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a dead spot in the north east corer of my house. I was hoping that this router would solve that problem. It did not.The 2.4G setting will work there with a poor signal. The 5G setting will not work there at all.I can't move the router any distance and try it because I would have to re-route a lot of cables to do so. My ecobee thermostat will only work on the 2.4G setting. This is not a problem I just thought I would mention that. Everything else works fine and if it weren't for the weak signal in the one spot I would have given it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Worked and set up exactly as described. Super easy set up, great instructions, and performs perfectly. Great instructions with these sort of items are a blessing and although I didn't experience any problems, the instructions clearly explained the set up and how to fix any problems.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Robert

customer_reviews.title: Dies after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Only worked well for 3 months after resetting and much frustration 5 months from purchase I only can connect about 50% of the time to the internet if I’m lucky, when it was working I had no complaints seemed to do the job well only wish it would’ve lasted longer for the price, my old 30$ router still works (slower and less range) about 5 years old now...
customer_reviews.author: Samantha M.

customer_reviews.title: Great device for a low price ($59)
customer_reviews.text: Received and installed. Definitely a signal increase over the modem itself. This unit allows Guest access which is what I activated myself by deactivating the regular Wi-Fi. I do this to reduce the possibility of anyone who has already Wi-Fi access or any code-breaker across the street to have access to the inside of the house (wired-connected devices). So basically it is only for internet access. Also do not activate QoS (quality of service) as it will reduce or split the bandwidth between services unless you do want it that way - I don’t. Now, I replaced my internet modem with a non-Wi-Fi one and this device handles all the Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: CSI GROUP

customer_reviews.title: Range as promised
customer_reviews.text: I live in rural South Dakota. My internet modem is in a barn about 700' from the house. I wanted a wifi router with extended range - and got exactly that. I can watch Netflix from my house just fine, no dropped connections at all. Setup is easy and straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID SMALL

customer_reviews.title: Good router for single room use or close devices
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router for my home internet; however, the signal could not reach my bedroom from the living room. I have a 1500 sq ft home and each room streams television. Signal was strong for the devices that occupied the same room but not for the adjacent bedrooms. Purchase if only providing signal to the small area or near by rooms. Signal will not travel around corners very far.
customer_reviews.author: Juice

customer_reviews.title: Could not hook it up and poor tech support
customer_reviews.text: I had problems hooking it up. Called tech support and had poor customer support. I re-installed my old router and it is still working fine. I returned the product the next day. It did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I installed this unit by recommended method and after a little antenna repositioning it is ...
customer_reviews.text: My two year old DIR-880L D-Link router started losing connection to one PC and a wireless printer so I replaced it with this unit. I installed this unit by recommended method and after a little antenna repositioning it is working solidly. The environment is a 2500 square one story house. The unit is typically interconnecting 10 or twelve wifi devices. My modem is a Motorola SB6141. I recommend router.
customer_reviews.author: Geep

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with range.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this router... Noticable inprovement over my 4 yr old Linksys router in regards to WiFi range. I have a 3/4 acre yard and I get a great signal even at the furthest point from the house now... I didn't have any WiFi at this location with the Linksys with the Linksys mounted high on the wall on a shelf. This Motorola router is sitting on my TV stand at a much lower position then the Linksys was and it seems to have no issue broadcasting at distance.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Web description leaves important info out.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 3 stars because I think it probably does what it says but it didn't work for me. Went thru the set up as instructed but it wouldn't connect to the internet. Called Motorola and it turns out that since I have a Crnturylink modem/router I was told to contact my service provider and have tham do a "bridge". This I'm told cancells the Centurylink router and enables the new router. I decided to just return it. Didn't want to risk messing up my existing system. Neither the instructions nor the web description tell you this.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca wallace

customer_reviews.title: Decent wifi router and fair price. But NOT 'extended' range.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and easy setup. However "extended" range is just not accurate. I used this to replace the generic no-external-antennae wifi router included by my internet provider, and saw absolutely ZERO increase in range for 2.4 or 5. Given the price, and the fact I can quit paying monthly "rent" for the generic router I got with my plan, I'm fine with that. But calling this an 'extended' range router is hokum.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: EZ setup for a cost efficient long range router!
customer_reviews.text: The router supplied by our provider has never covered our house so we have a second upstairs more centrally located. When it passed away I tried finding one locally which had good range. The local big box stores inventory was SAD. For the cost of this router I figured nothing to lose. Setup wad easy and quick and the range compares to routers I have used costing far more. Fortunately for us we have good neighbors because it was delivered to the wrong house! Other than that it shipped in one day and so far I am pleased with the Motorola Router.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews mentioned, the range on this is pretty limited. But there’s no app to bother with, the parental controls are decent, and it’s easy to configure. I wish you could block websites in the parental controls, but you can use opendns for that. Also, does not have a remote configuration ability, you have to be on the network. That’s either a limitation or a security feature depending on your perspective.
customer_reviews.author: CoTD

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. It was pretty easy to set up, it connected to all of my devices exactly as expected. It even connected right to my slave router with not additional setup. The signal is strong, and all of my devices have a consistently much better Speed Test result. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for Frontier FIOS
customer_reviews.text: Used this to upgrade the standard Wi-Fi router from Frontier FIOS. The range on the 2.4Ghz band is twice what I had before. I have a standard neighborhood lot and can get strong signal all the way around and out to the road. Couldn't do that before. Also loads video much faster, even with 4 devices streaming Netflix at once for a test. The 5Ghz signal doesn't reach outside but that's sort of expected. Interface is simple and I had this router unboxed, hooked up, and the SSID name and password changed all in 5 minutes. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Poor performance and constant signal and internet drops. Returned immediately and replaced with a different router and it’s night and day better. Stay clear.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dude From TX

customer_reviews.title: Best value for an excellent router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the WiFi router Spectrum was renting to me for $5 a month. Setup was very easy. The default IP didn’t interfere with the default IP of my existing router. When tested I was get 116 +/- Mbps WiFi on my phone when standing in the same room. The speed was about the same on the pc connected with Ethernet cable. At the other end of my house on the second floor speed dropped to about 40mbps. It was about as far away as the two points could be and still be in doors. It currently handles 3 ring devices, 2 phones, and 3 tablets. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: My last tech support call was handled by Eddy who provided excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Customer technical support is outstanding! I had two reasons to call with the set up and in both cases the calls were answered in a timely manner and the tech reps were extraordinary! My last tech support call was handled by Eddy who provided excellent customer service. He thoroughly and patiently answered my questions and guided me through the process which included making changes to my Windows 7 network configuration and options. I give this product and its customer support a AAA rating.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne M Gray

customer_reviews.title: Reliable router
customer_reviews.text: This router works well, and is easy to set up. I have had no glitches or problems, and have never had to restart the router due to errors. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I feel it should do slightly better in its coverage range. I have a 2200 sq ft house, and had to install a wifi extender to obtain adequate coverage in the far end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the old belkin router that was only a year old, but latest firmware was back in 2016 and they weren't sending any new updates. I tried to upgrade the firmware at least 4 times in the year I owned it. But after installing this Motorola Router, my signal strength throughout the house has been phenomenal!!! I can't believe what a positive difference it has made. I happy that I bought this. And yes, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J.

customer_reviews.title: Great range constantly has short disconnections
customer_reviews.text: From the start there were disconnects from virtually all connected products. I initially blamed the various products. Gave a couple of unfair reviews for several products, but eventually figured out that the fractional second disconnects from the router were to blame for all the problems. Even the hard wired computer had a trading application frequently disconnecting. Alexa products worked off and on and watching the connections come and go on the Kasa app was like playing whack a mole to get the various switches and plugs to work with Alexa. Sorry that it had such problems as the range of the product was awesome. Never had such good range with any previous and more expensive router. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kimper

customer_reviews.title: good range
customer_reviews.text: We have a barn and a small cabin about 70 yards from our house. This wi fi router lives up to its reputation for having a good 2.4 GHz signal at longer distances. Using this router I get about a half strength signal at both locations which is adequate for streaming music, texting and similar uses. I'm very happy that I don't need to use a booster or switch to a mesh system.
customer_reviews.author: Vicentino

customer_reviews.title: it is Good
customer_reviews.text: It unit is functional well. It is easy to install and work as it should be. The Only reason I did not give a 5 stars is the signal just a little bit better, may be 10~15 feet better. It is still better then my old one, by if you really need long range it is a bit short. But if you just need to replace one, this one is good and the price is low.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good only for max two bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Not what I hoped for Only good for smaller spaces I didnot had a good signal in 4 bedroom house I returned it
customer_reviews.author: E. E

customer_reviews.title: Super EASY -> GREAT range!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install, less than 5 minutes and I have good signal strength even in the back yard and street out in front of our house. Speed tests plugged in directly off of the router exceeded 80Mbps download / 30Mbps upload. Totally happy with this Motorola AC1700 WiFi router!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Family

customer_reviews.title: This is a powerful and dependable router!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Netgear router that could not hold the internet signal and I was contantly having to re-boot it. This Motorola router has eliminated that problem entirely and now I can enjoy streaming the shows and movies I enjoy watching. Thank you Motorola!!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Edward Howell, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great router, easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: A great wireless router for the money! With my old wireless modem, I was only gettin about 2 Mbps to my tablets and phones compared to the 35 Mbps I was getting from the modem wired directly to my desktop computer. I disabled the wifi on my modem and installed this Motorola AC 1700 and the speed on my tablets immediately jumped to 17 Mbps. Could not tell any difference in the speed between the 2.4 ghz and the 5 ghz, but still a big improvement over what I had. Also, very easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Atmotech

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This works very well and has a really good range. I added a range extender and now have great service in an office that in in an outside building. The one thing I find odd is the my iPhone doesn’t work well on it. My phone has to be on the extender. Other than tat it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me by Cable company
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and I get Wifi throughout my entire apartment now.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Leone

customer_reviews.title: Know way to get back to them to explain the problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Motorola AC1700 March 2019 and it stopped working in July 2019. I went back on the site and there is know way to get in touch with them. I wouldn’t buy from this company again and would advise others not to buy this product. 🙁🙁 On the box it says it has a two year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ivypoo

customer_reviews.title: Dual Band a Plus
customer_reviews.text: This wifi router worked out OK but I was not impressed by their claim for extended range. My previous wifi router didn't make this boast and the Motorola is about the same - maybe only slightly better. It was a breeze to setup and item was delivered on time as promised.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. English

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This router is worse than the router provided by the Cable company. I thought I was upgrading but it turns out that this router just doesn't perform like it is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constant signal drops
customer_reviews.text: Constantly drops signal. Wen with a Google Mesh, and am 4 star happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jarski

customer_reviews.title: great range
customer_reviews.text: Range is fantastic have a 1 acre property and the old tp-link router would be spotty on the edge. This easily beats it. For a residential router this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product and has been functioning to purpose. At times the signal could be stronger but that could be related to other external factors more than to do with the actual router. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Guidry

customer_reviews.title: I tried
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not do any better than my current router when it came to WiFi coverage
customer_reviews.author: Steve  kahn

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.text: "Meh" is my best description of this thing. The interface is a little nicer looking than other brands I've used, but no less difficult to navigate. Don't let it's "porcupine" looks and "extended range" moniker fool you, the coverage, and bandwidth on this thing are nothing to write home about. It's just another router. My old Netgear (going on 6 years old that finally bit the dust) could slug it out with this thing any day before it died.
customer_reviews.author: RLTByers

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine, even through some walls.  We have had to reset it, but could be modem.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I will update if anything changes. It seems to work well through a couple of walls in our house, which is good. I haven't yet tried it on the back room of the house, which I will do soon.
customer_reviews.author: MyBookie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and operate.
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play! Very easy to setup, login and operate. The system is self explaned on website. Good router and the 5g bands are good enough for my home!
customer_reviews.author: SWiel

customer_reviews.title: This device doubled my internet speed over Wi-Fi here in the office at the front of my home.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for Alexa, a half dozen or so computers and phones and tablets.... working like a champ! - We are experiencing very close to directly connected Ethernet speed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Ok, to be honest here, I was told you had to bridge it, I did, it didn't work, so after a lot of research on youtube, I found out that you do not have to bridge it, Just install it and plug the lines in and let it go.
customer_reviews.author: albert perts

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and great WiFi coverage
customer_reviews.text: This router was installed and up and running in minutes. The WiFi coverage is extremely good and I can stream hi def without a hiccup even while there are multiple devices using the router in my house. I’d buy it again !!
customer_reviews.author: Roy J. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Easy hookup
customer_reviews.text: Works good but wish I would have spent 30.00 more and got the AC2600. It has built in extender!!!!!!! Now it will cost me 99.00 more but oh well, l should have listened!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: steve c.

customer_reviews.title: I reccomend!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Easy to lock kids' devices out when they misbehave, or when they need some time off from electronic goodies! I have had an Amazon fire stick, three iPhones, two tablets, & an XBox one all streaming YouTube and my connection didn't even burp!
customer_reviews.author: That guy from the U.P.

customer_reviews.title: Working great! Was able to get the new wireless cameras ...
customer_reviews.text: Working great! Was able to get the new wireless cameras hooked up and working with the bigger signal. Looking forward to an electronic item that needs 5G.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great range
customer_reviews.text: I’m in a travel trailer about 60 feet away so the router is going through two 2x6 walls and a travel trailer wall. The source is 12mbps. I am able to stream shows with ease. Great router.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great range for wifi
customer_reviews.text: This is a good router that provides great range due to it's output power and six antennas. I have yet been able to figure out how to turn it into an access point so I still have double NAT but that's a small price to pay for the increased range.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: WIFI Power!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace the low quality router supplied by Spectrum that was always running out of memory. It was a really good decision. Easy setup and configuration. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Teknoray

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well where I live
customer_reviews.text: Was not any better than the one I had. Since I have this a chance for two months, I ate the cost as they would not accept a return. Bought an Netgear ORBI. It cost about twice as much but it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Carrollo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work as advertised. The modem/router from the internet provider gets better signal and is faster. Was a waste of money, i couldn't even sell it for 15% of what i paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Jaber

customer_reviews.title: Worth more than what it sells for
customer_reviews.text: Setup was quick, works flawless running a home security camera, 3 smart tvs, an xbox and 2 phones. Signal strenghth is excellent. Can walk about 3 houses down and still pull a smidge of signal off either bands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dial up on steroids
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so just perfect for gigabit service and below. Range almost too good. Damn neighbors keep trying to get the password but won't pay half the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Jaci bateman

customer_reviews.title: Very easy  to install.
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to install and works so much better than my old one. I have only been using it for one day but it works great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the easiest installation I've had to do. It's essentially a plug and play system. Has been working great from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Eulalio Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give a good review, but this item never worked properly and I had to return it. But, it was at least an easy and quick return.
customer_reviews.author: Posey

customer_reviews.title: Cord on Router doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The USB cord doesn't work. My husband became very agitated and plugged in the old router but didn't change the cord. It didn't work. He plugged it in with the older cord and we're good to go. Hopefully he'll try plugging the new one in with the old cord. The new cord DOES NOT look new!! This is the only time I've been disappointed with a purchase from Amazon. Maybe a new cord would help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good range, not fantastic. No was button
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no wps button. Not that big of a deal but kind of inconvenient for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work any better than my cheap router with only 2 antenna. Cuts in and out constantly. Doesn't even send the signal well to my upstairs floor in a small townhome.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dual Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and was so easy to install & worked great that I bought one for my daughter for Christmas 🎄
customer_reviews.author: Don Krupinski

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk will not stay connected.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to work okay not that great but it was alright from first month now that I can't return it the problem is giving me it keeps disconnecting you connected in 5 minutes later disconnect you and it will connect you again then it will disconnect you. Really really upsetting I have rebooted it countless times. Totally dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: William K

customer_reviews.title: Great range, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Much better range than the router supplied by the cable company. I would buy it again. I have a ranch house and this router penetrated through four walls. Do not need any bridges, or other fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Noel E. Spears

customer_reviews.title: Hey it works correct
customer_reviews.text: I like it so simple to hook up. And It reaches most of the house. The price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Marston G Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have mine in the main room and gives me 100 percent signal in adjacent rooms and had been no problem what so ever since I bought it>
customer_reviews.author: Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement router, was pleasantly surprised on how easy it was to setup. Works great we have way more range with this router than we had our previous one. Nice to be able to change router settings from your moblie device. I would definitely recommend this router and would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie8119

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy set up, plugged in and hard wire was working. WiFi wouldn't connect at first but just powered off and then back on and it worked fine. Much better signal coverage than previous. We have large home and signal is great upstairs and down
customer_reviews.author: The Tucker’s

customer_reviews.title: Strong Wi-Fi Reception
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set-up in only a few minutes. We had a combo router wi-fi that we purchased in August and it had been nothing but problems with internet dropping (would have returned it to Amazon but missed the return date not knowing it was the problem). We went with using a separate modem and the Motorola Router and no more problems with the internet dropping.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard J.

customer_reviews.title: Not Really An Extended Range
customer_reviews.text: Same performance in the 2.4GHz as the crappy WiFi router supplied by the cable company. The whole extended range is BS. Unfortunately, I can’t return it any longer.
customer_reviews.author: capeomar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but range is only so-so
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Motorola products but the range on this WiFi is only so-so
customer_reviews.author: ecgeorgia

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced another router, I can't believe the difference! I have greater coverage and nowhere near the speed loss I had. Would recommend this router to anyone, great buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: Steve R.

customer_reviews.title: works well 20 feet from my other computer.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had HDMI or USB inputs and outputs
customer_reviews.author: Gunnard Hedwall

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: works well. the range is not as far as the comcast modem hence 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, very strong..
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! So much faster than the one supplied by the cable company..
customer_reviews.author: Richard Green

customer_reviews.title: Speed
customer_reviews.text: It seems not that fast for more than 5 connection, it automatic come for 5G connection but sometimes doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Did not have tech support, versatility, or screen quality does not apply. Item was a new router. Works great and easy to set up. 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jan H.

customer_reviews.title: Not the one to buy for multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: Had to be an older model. Wouldn’t work with all of my devices. No app to connect to it. No reset on the modem when it crashed and it did it a lot. Great price though \_(ツ)_/ ̄
customer_reviews.author: MJenkins

customer_reviews.title: It's decent
customer_reviews.text: Quality of connection isn't as great as I had thought. However, set up was a breeze unlike some routers out there. I'm using it as an access point to improve the range of my WiFi. Since this router isn't being used around the main area, it doesn't bother me as much. Decent router at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: uzi

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great wireless router. Easy setup and all my devices connect without issues. I have not had to call tech support so my rating on that is influenced by everything else going well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dirrim

customer_reviews.title: This is a great wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wifi Router. I now no longer require to use extenders in my home. This does not have a wps function. I cannot complain the specs did not state it did. It is sleek and functions great.
customer_reviews.author: Csablich

product_meta.title: MOTOROLA AC1700 Dual-Band WiFi Gigabit Router with Extended Range for Home, Model MR1700
product_meta.description: Motorola's MR1700 AC1700 WiFi Gigabit Router is able to transmit high-speed WiFi data over a wide area, even to distant rooms in large homes. One reason is 4 antennas for the 2.4 GHz frequency band, the best band for sending WiFi to distant locations. The MR1700 also performs very well in apartments and condominiums that are bombarded by wireless noise from neighbors. Model MR1700’s wireless performance is outstanding when used with smartphones, HDTVs, computers, game stations, and other wireless devices. This WiFi router has better range than much more expensive routers, which typically have only 3 antennas for the important 2.4 GHz frequency band. MR1700 setup is fast and easy, with phone, email, and Web support from the USA. 2 year warranty from Motorola.
feature_bullets: CONCURRENT DUAL-BAND WIFI operation supporting 2.4GHz and 5GHz. 4 antennas for the 2.4 GHz frequency band, the best band for long-range WiFi. This results in extended range and high speed, with better performance than much more expensive routers.

PLUG THE MR1700 ROUTER into whatever cable modem or other broadband modem you choose. This provides a high-speed Internet link for all your local WiFi and Ethernet devices - HDTVs, smartphones, game stations, computers, tablets, and more.
NETFLIX, YOUTUBE, Amazon Video, Hulu, the Web, and much more can be delivered to many devices at the same time through the MR1700’s 4 Gigabit Ethernet LAN ports and through WiFi.
EASY SETUP, user-friendly firewall, parental controls, guest network capability, Dual Core Processor, and more.
EXPERT SUPPORT from the USA. 2 year warranty from Motorola, a company you trust.
